website_summaries.verdict: A great keyboard for gamers or those looking for extra options and great quality.
pros: Features mechanical keys and customizable multicolored lighting
Includes angle adjustment and sturdy rubber feet for extra stability
Small and light enough to be easily portable

customer_reviews.title: Poor Construction - Right Arrow Key Stuck and Support calls it "Cosmetic Issue"
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely disappointed in this keyboard. Right out of the box the right arrow key gets easily stuck when pressing it. This is very frustrating when web browsing or trying to watch a video because the key is engaged. It was like this out of the box and never went away after 2 weeks of use. It seems the cause of this issue is poor quality control as it seems the plastic of the bottom border will brush up against the keycap and prevent it from disengaging. The worst part about this whole process was dealing with Logitech Customer Support. They denied that it was a real issue and called it a cosmetic issue. This is ridiculous. Buyer Beware.
customer_reviews.author: seanthebomb

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed with the quality
customer_reviews.text: I got it a month ago and it broke after use. The keycap fell of on the left control key and the key piece that goes in the keyboard broke off the keycap. Update: Contacted Logitech and they shipped out a replacement keyboard ASAP under warranty. I may have gotten a fluke but they made it right with no hassles!
customer_reviews.author: William L Rich

customer_reviews.title: Romer-G switches are a problem waiting to happen
customer_reviews.text: I've used the keyboard for months with no problem but eventually I noticed that my caps lock key would become loose and fall out. Eventually i realized the plastic pegs on the key cap broke off into the switch on the keyboard so if you play games like me and sometimes readjust your keyboard this is an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Darin E.

customer_reviews.title: Metallic reverb spring sound
customer_reviews.text: Almost all the keys give off a spring metallic echo sound when you bottom out/press the key fully until it hits the metal backplate. The spacebar is especially loud. I have recorded a video of how the keys sound. Best to turn up the volume and wear some headphones to hear it clearly, listen carefully after each button is pressed down and released. The noise is incredibly distracting and really is a shame on an otherwise fantastic keyboard. I thought my keyboard was just a bad, defective one, but it seems like other users have this issue as well. If you search youtube other Logitech Romer G keyboards including the Pro also have this issue.
customer_reviews.author: NW

customer_reviews.title: Excellent keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard for work and play. I like the smaller profile. It give better keyboard and mouse alignment for right-handed folk. The Logitech software makes it easy to configure your color schema. I do wish the volume controls were different like with some other Logitech keyboards. I like the wheel much better than using a function key and then some far off keys to control volume. Minor issue as this is a great gaming keyboard overall.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Software *DOES NOT WORK*
customer_reviews.text: The Logitech G-Hub software for Mac is continually broken. It'll sit there spinning the logo at launch. It fails to reconnect to the mouse after the computer sleeps. It's beyond useless, and worse, with the newest Logitech hardware (including silent revs of older hardware), even such basic settings as the lighting configuration are no longer stored on the device, so if G-Hub doesn't connect, you'll be stuck with an annoying, distracting rainbow to look at. DO NOT BUY. The hardware is great, but G-Hub makes it useless.
customer_reviews.author: A. Barnat

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard is fantastic, I love it
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is fantastic, I love it. I switched to this from a logitech G 910 orion because I wanted the smaller form factor and liked the design better. So far I love the feel of this keyboard the key-switches feel fantastic they work well for gaming and typing the feed back from the keys is perfect in MHO and they click is much quieter than my last keyboard, if that matters to you like it does to me you'll love this keyboard. I would absolutely recommend this to anyone looking to upgrade. I am a programmer, avid gamer, and enthusiast builder so I spend a ton of time behind my keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: aaron

customer_reviews.title: Decent keyboard but...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this keyboard for about a year and it is a decent keyboard... when it works. However, the USB cable I got with the keyboard stopped working within the first few months of me getting it. So, I got a replacement cable, no biggie. Then, recently, the ctrl key of my keyboard broke, and I've never been that rough with it. The keycap broke off, and its broken pin is stuck inside the key. Overall, if I could go back in time, I would avoid this keyboard and spend it on a different TKL at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Rambler

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Research & Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small key board but not for gaming-but for my office. I looked at many, many gaming keyboards and bought two. I ordered the Logitech G after a less expensive model. The less expensive model was good and I was happy. When the Logitech G came, I set it up and was very, very impressed with it's responsiveness. I make less errors by far as compared to any other keyboard that I have used. I found no real good office applicaiton reviews-if you are looking for an excellent keyboard that is smaller in space consumption, look no longer. Logitech makes some of the best products out there and this keyboard is well, well, well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: G-Man

customer_reviews.title: Logo light issue. Overall solid keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Overall a solid keyboard, but the software forgets certain settings sometimes and the logo light turns on, on startup despite having it off on the profile and uploading the profile to the keyboard. The software has to start up for the logo light to turn off. Would like this keyboard a lot more if they got rid of the logo light, and instead had it etched or pressed on he plastic. I don’t need my setup looking time square with all these G logos lighting up everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: A solid TKL with a great feel
customer_reviews.text: My previous keyboard was a NovaTouch TKL, which I loved until it the keys started to glitch out after a few years. The G Pro compares favorably, even though it's a good deal less expensive. I'm very happy with the noise level and the feel. There is a minor ringing, mechanical echo after each keypress, but I've encountered that with other mechanicals, and I quickly got used to it. The keyboard's overall construction is solid without feeling like a brick when I need to move it around.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Efrem

customer_reviews.title: Very FAST keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is more than 50ms faster for me than an Eagletec "gaming" keyboard I bought on Amazon. If you google "online reaction time test", you can measure the response of your entire system, including you. I get about 165ms with this keyboard, 209ms with a Natural 4000, and 235ms with the Eagletec. If you want up to 50ms faster key processing, consider this keyboard. Unfortunately for me, my Esc key is defective, so I'll have to exchange this one. That doesn't dampen my enthusiasm for this keyboard though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Feels good. Looks good. Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard to replace my beloved Ducky Shine II because I wanted a Tenkeyless option since I started playing FPS games more exclusively and I need the desk space to run low eDPI for more precise control and tracking with my aim. I absolutely love gaming on this keyboard. The custom lighting profiles and macroable function keys are amazing as well. My Ducky had keys to open my browser, email, calculator and My Computer. This doesn't have those keys but the function keys can be set to perform those and many more jobs!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Sears

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard is a great purchase for gaming and typing!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard's switches are so nice and easy to press! Typing on it is actually fun and gaming is so much easier than other keyboards! When Logitech says the switches are up to 25% faster, they are not lying, the keys are nice to type on and I found that I was faster at typing. The lighting is fully customizable however the white, like the g810, looks more like blue than white. The shade of purple is my favorite color on this keyboard and I use it with lime green accents. This is my favorite keyboard I have ever owned or use and I would recommend this to anyone who games or types very often!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: CTRL Keycap snaps off, otherwise good keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard, but too expensive given the amount of people having problems with the Left CTRL keycap and other heavy use keycaps breaking. I hope I can get a replacement keycap. I feel I should buy a few of them at this point. I bought mine for $129 and it's now selling for $178 which is ridiculous given this structural weakness!
customer_reviews.author: D. Tuck

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard at incredible price!
customer_reviews.text: First impressions: 1) Solid build 2) Very bright LEDs 3) Absolutely beautiful looking 4) Exceptional typing experience I was very nervous about buying a Romer G keyboard as I'd never used one before. I am disabled with serious issues with my hands. So I spent many hours researching current mechanical key engineering before selecting this keyboard. After a day of use I am extremely pleased with my choice. This keyboard excels at gaming and perhaps surprisingly it's also an excellent choice for plain old typing. So far the only negatives have been my experience with registration and trying to link keyboard with my Logitech G300s mouse. This is a great deal for an exceptional keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: P. T. Gargoyl

customer_reviews.title: After 1 year of use 3 key caps snapped and broke inside the switch.
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard, nice and quiet. But it breaks after a long time use. My A, S, and N key caps broke with part of the key cap stem still inside the keyboard. My razer blackwidow keyboard is still being actively used from when I bought it in 2014 (a family member uses it to game and work). Disappointed because the warrantly on the website is going to take about 7 - 10 days to get the keyboard back, which means I will have no keyboard to use for that amount of time, which is a long time. Sucks and it's a pain in the arse.
customer_reviews.author: Levi Cass

customer_reviews.title: Almost everything about this keyboard is wonderful. The lighting IMO is superior to other brands
customer_reviews.text: This was my second mechanical keyboard that I've tried in the past few months. Almost everything about this keyboard is wonderful. The lighting IMO is superior to other brands. Small form factor makes it easier to type. Software is easy to use. The only thing I cannot stand is the keys feel reallllllllllly stiff. It only took around an hour before my forearms hurt. Maybe this is because I'm not use to mechanical keyboards yet? I ended up switching to a razer ornata chroma(membrane keyboard) and find it easier to type with. Because of this, I'm giving this product 3 out of 5 stars since I bought this for typing.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Romer-G: Works amazing after getting used to it. Give it a shot!
customer_reviews.text: Tested the Coolermaster Masterkeys S & Leopold FC750R, Magicforce 68 and finally decided to go with this one. The Romer-G switches take a day to get used to, but once you do, you'll love them. They actuate very fast, and the quality of this keyboard holds up to other $100+ mech kbs. The RGB lighting is awesome. Give the Romer-G's a shot!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Chang

customer_reviews.title: BEST KEYBOARD IN THE WORLD. WORTH EVERY PENNY
customer_reviews.text: So i bought this keyboard because I've gotten into professional gaming and i wanted something solid. It exceeded my expectations. Aside from the beautiful design, it is pre-programmed to recognize many games key bindings and automatically change LED based on the game. For one game it turned red when health was low. It's honestly fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: RGB Dying Quickly
customer_reviews.text: I have had this keyboard for a little over 6 months, and it's good to use, I like the keys, and for the actual use of the keyboard I don't have any problems. However, I paid extra for a keyboard with custom lighting, and the RGB is already failing. I have 4 keys so far that have dead blue lighting, so I can only select colors that don't include blue for those keys. Everything else works to par, but the RGB has not been reliable, so if that's what you're after(and I don't know why you would compromise when spending $100+ on a keyboard), you should look at another product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Martin

customer_reviews.title: The keypresses/switches are a bit lackluster
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the board is fantastic, the colours are on point, bright and exactly what you ask for... but the feel of the switches don't compare to the high-end. It's a fantastic TKL (ten key-less) option, especially for price performance, and it integrates beautifully into the software, but otherwise, just for pure switch quality, I'm thinking I may swap to a different keyboard. If switches make or break a keyboard for you, the soft rubbery feeling at the end of a stroke makes it feel a bit weird for FPS's and MMORPGs. Would recommend, but if you have more money, I would definitely splurge on a slightly nicer TKL like the one's linus tech tips just reviewed.
customer_reviews.author: Faramarz Munshi

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, despite proprietary switch design.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a tenkeyless mechanical keyboard, as I was tired of my desk being so crowded, and needing to have to tilt my keyboard when gaming to have enough room for my mouse. The keys are very responsive and quiet - my teammates no longer complain about how click clacky my keyboard is. I love the lighting modes. Colors are great and match my mouse. Compact and sturdy. I don't know how long the keys are going to last, though. I haven't had it very long and already have wear spots on the space bar from my thumbs.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: so this was absolutely perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: pricey but worth it for me. I didn't want an insanely metallic clicky keyboard that echoed throughout the house, so this was absolutely perfect for me. clicky but not too much so. i really love the color and light up keys as well as being able to coordinated it with my logitech mouse.
customer_reviews.author: ddarko

customer_reviews.title: nice keyboard, really fast actuation time
customer_reviews.text: nice keyboard, really fast actuation time. I have Cherry MX black, blue and brown keyboard and the logitech G switch is just something unique. For people who is living years with Cherry MX switches they need couple days to get used to this new switch. price tag is too high for a TKL, I would recommend everyone to buy G810 if you just want a keyboard without considering space.
customer_reviews.author: Gum

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I'd like to start by saying, this is a great keyboard. I love gaming with it and the build quality is great as well as the RGB, it's not overly bright and looks very clean. Its heavy which shows that its sturdy if you accidentally hit it or something like that. I do have to say, the software is the issue. It doesn't save some times and when I make a freestyle it goes away when I boot up my pc again. All in all really good keyboard for the price and I would recommend buying this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Feels like a membrane keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is very disappointing. It's cheap plastic for one...which at this price point, you'd expect aluminum. My biggest gripe is, it feels like I'm typing on a membrane keyboard. It doesn't even feel like linear switches. My keys get stuck too, which seems to be a common problem. Bot impressed at all by these roamer switches.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard if you can Afford
customer_reviews.text: I got this keyboard around half a year ago, its been great for playing games(starcraft2 and overwatch mostly). I really enjoy the mechanical keys more than my old keyboard that had Cherry Red. I would recommend this to someone who doesn't have a budget so much since the price is quite a bit more than a lot of other keyboards. But if you can spend the 120$ I would recommend it. The lighting effects with the logitech app is very cool, I have mine set up to be purple normally and turn a pinkish color when I hit a key. I
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and tactile
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is a solid build. Lighting options on the board are easy to adjust. Feedback from the board is quick and feels great to type on. Great for gaming and work use. Only real complaint is that the Blue LED on a few keys stopped working completely. Logitech provided a replacement keyboard after I opened a case with them for a warranty claim. Compact design allows for easy transport when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Would be great, except right arrow issue
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this keyboard is great especially the RGB. However, as others have pointed out, pressing the right arrow key on some keyboards makes it "stick". Not like physically sticks down, but the arrow key acts as if it's always pressed down. I was considering getting a replacement, but I didn't want to risk having the same failure further down the line when getting a replacement would be more difficult.
customer_reviews.author: vic

customer_reviews.title: The software is difficult to configure
customer_reviews.text: After trying to configure the product, I gave up and the keyboard some how was configured with keyboard colors that I found pleasing. So I kept the keyboard. Today, a few months from the two year warranty, the keys are changing colors for no discernable reason. It may be COVID-19, it may be the holiday weekend, but Logitech support is not responsive.
customer_reviews.author: popcornboy2

customer_reviews.title: It’s above average
customer_reviews.text: Within 5 minutes of opening it, one of the keys’ red LED stopped working. Luckily I like blue, but it’s disappointing. Overall it’s an above average plastic keyboard which will do what you need it to do. Nothing about it will blow you away. If you have the money to burn then I’d say go for it. If you’re looking for an ultra premium keyboard with keys that feel smooth like piano keys/metal keys then maybe go more upscale.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Really disappointed in this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a couple of months back after doing an extensive search for the best keyboard. Worked great for the first month or so and then has gone completely downhill from there. Keys are constantly sticking when I am playing games even after cleaning. Aside from sticking, some keys don't even register when gaming. I would consider the keyboard in mint condition. Probably will not be buying another Logitech product again unfortunately. I cannot be spending this much money on a product that I get only 6 months out of.
customer_reviews.author: Aidan Logstrom

customer_reviews.title: Best version of Romer-G keyboard yet.
customer_reviews.text: The best keyboard I ever used. This is my second keyboard I own with Logitech's Proprietary Romer-G key switches. They are much more quiet than the Cherry MX speed switches. The only downside to these proprietary switches are you cannot buy custom keycaps, if you wish to customize the keyboard later. Note: These Romer-G switches has a slight tactile feedback(which I love) compared to the Cherry MX speed switches(which are linear). It has a detachable USB connection on the keyboard side, which can come in handy if you need to pack it up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it, Very responsive, and custom effects.
customer_reviews.text: Would highly recommend to any gamer out there. Build quality is what you would expect for Logitech. If you are looking for a mechanical keyboard this is a good start...depending on what kind of switches you prefer these come with logitechs very own Romer G Switches, which people say are someone like brown switches and quiet. Comes down to preference.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H

customer_reviews.title: Love this G series from Logitech
customer_reviews.text: recently bought the whole set of G Series gamer accessories from Logitech, which includes speakers, mouse and keyboard, which there's different ones to choose from, but overall the keyboard has solid keys and beautiful lighting and effects and syncs well and it's a very nice small size so it doesn't consume too much of your desk space.
customer_reviews.author: BrandonH

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my husband and some of the keys stopped working within 6-9 months, the lights don't show up as programmed, and he's cleaned it with no luck. Contacted Logitech pretty much said we're SOL.
customer_reviews.author: K Moore

customer_reviews.title: Keys became unresponsive after a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: Keys became unresponsive and started repeating multiple times. Very disappointed with the quality of this product from Logitech. My Razer Black widow ultimate keyboard is still going strong after 8 years. Shoddy quality and wont be buying another keyboard from Logitech. I purchase this while I was in the US. Now I'm in India and the Logitech service support here has informed me that they do not offer warranty support for this product as it was purchased in the US.
customer_reviews.author: A-Aron

customer_reviews.title: Love the romer g switches
customer_reviews.text: There are not enough great things I can say about this keyboard. Some of the cleanest rgb leds because of the romer g switches, speaking of the switches my previous keyboard was cherry blue and these are superior in my opinion. Typing is so much faster once you learn to not bottom out. The only issue I've had were my function keys were flashing out of sync and all I had to do was turn off game integration in settings.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: When it work's its great but has issues
customer_reviews.text: Have had this keyboard since it first come out I love the build quality & feel, like everything about this keyboard is amazing hand's down light's & the light show's it offer's is pretty amazing. Only issue I have & can't get anything figured out how to fix the issue but on one single push of multiple keys it double pushes key's like u hit a single key push key in it work's everytime but on release of the same key it will push again & I cannot get it fixed
customer_reviews.author: andrea

customer_reviews.title: Lights are failing after less than one year
customer_reviews.text: I've owned lots of Logitech products, and prior to this one, none has broken. But the lights for the keys are beginning to fail. One is completely out and two are dimming to the point where I expect they'll fail soon. I'm still within the warranty period, so I may take it up with Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: Eric J.

customer_reviews.title: Really hate the price
customer_reviews.text: Really hate the price, but I tried mechanical keyboards with Cherry Brown switches and simply couldn't use them. This one is comfortable and fitting small spaces. Playing Rust or Starcraft is good, typing is good too. One small issue I had in the begging the left shift was sticky for first 20 sec. After 20 sec I coundn't notice the stickiness.
customer_reviews.author: Homelyn

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard, RGB problems
customer_reviews.text: It almost perfect, feels amazing, the response time and the feel of the keys are simply amazing. Even thought this keyboard is great at most task, there's a major problem with the RGB, some keys start to lose color over time even when you keep the RGB lights off, that's something that shouldn't be happening on a $100+ usd keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Samael Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent High Performance Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Really great keyboard. Logitech makes nice stuff and this keyboard is no exception. The keys are responsive and the software is easy to use. The problem with a lot of the gaming / performance keyboards is that they get overly fancy and tend to have little quirks or reliability issues that diminish their overall quality. This is not the case with this keyboard. High performance with no tradeoffs. I use this for gaming (starcraft), but I am considering purchasing another for work even though it would be overkill.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Girardi

customer_reviews.title: Blue LED's behind 6 keys failed after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: I've had this keyboard for a bout a year. I personally like the feel of Romer-G switches and I like the design of the keyboard but I'm pretty unhappy with the quality of the LED's. Within 6 months blue LED's started burning out behind keys and now at 1 year after I purchased it there are 6 keys without working blue LED's. The red and yellow LED's all still work fine but those 6 keys can't change to the proper colors without blue.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Wood

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard for office and home or gaming and streaming
customer_reviews.text: coming from blue switch keyboards. editing and streaming pc both blue switch for very long time. first touch, first feeling, first in action. this keyboard is very sensitive. perfect for fps. bit heavy on press but very fast respond. very low noise profile. love it very much.
customer_reviews.author: oMaMori

customer_reviews.title: Best Mechanical Keyboard I've Used!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the only LED keyboards that doesn't have any bleed out around the keys (may depend on the brightness level chosen). Only the characters are lit up which I prefer. So far I like the Romer G switches better than any Cherry switches that I've tried over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Poor Tom

customer_reviews.title: Sticks button
customer_reviews.text: Left shift button sticks, constantly sticks .. how to play now? 109$ , and i cant refund because i live in azerbaijan, and ship back its very hard.. gg im frustration
customer_reviews.author: Oksana Rasulova

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade from Razer
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a huge Razer keyboard and going tenkeyless feels SO nice. The software is a little strange and wonky to use, but the keyboard is great. The clickiness is just right - a little muted, but still very responsive. Really solid little keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Heather D.

customer_reviews.title: Received a not working keyboard  , VERY Dissatisfied
customer_reviews.text: the keyboard not working out of the box, am VERY DISSITISFIED in Logitech. i have bought from them in past 6 months, there G703 mouse and G933 headset. and am very happy with them but this BAD keyboard. has changed my mind ,,,,,,,,,, VERY DISSATISFIED
customer_reviews.author: Fahad Alharbi

customer_reviews.title: I think cherry red switch feels better than this switch after a long time comparison.
customer_reviews.text: Great design. But I still think cherry red switch feels better than this switch after a long time comparison. I mean, I win't notice much difference while gaming, but when I aim on comparing the feeling, logitech switch feels worse than cherry one. But all the stuff related to design is great. I don't know if I will recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: not even a full year and a bunch of backlit keys are off-color
customer_reviews.text: pros - good feel - nice size - usb connection never comes out but easily removed for transporting/(cleaning!) cons - color profile never stuck past reboot (always reverted to rainbow) - backlight failure in under a year
customer_reviews.author: Jacob E

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality LEDs die over time
customer_reviews.text: I've had this keyboard for about two years now. Typing on it is a good experience; however, there are some quality issues with the device. The blue LEDs in the keys wear out over time, and cause color issues. If you care about what your setup looks like, I don't recommend this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: notmadeofbeef

customer_reviews.title: Software is really great. I also bought the Coolermaster 10 keyless and ...
customer_reviews.text: WOW what a keyboard. Not very loud so I use it at work. Software is really great. I also bought the Coolermaster 10 keyless and while that is fine for gaming the software for the Coolermaster is garbage. This is a really great all around keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Dawg

customer_reviews.title: ... a month now and I have to say it's great. The keys feel alright
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this keyboard for a month now and I have to say it's great. The keys feel alright, the keyboard is compact, the backlight is nice and it works with many games profiles. Just a little issue though, the Caps Lock LED notifier stopped working. Not sure if this is an issue with Logitech drivers or Windows 10. Already reported it with Logitech Support, no solution yet. (Will update review if they help me fix this.)
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Martinez

customer_reviews.title: OUTSTANDING!
customer_reviews.text: I had to get a refund for this product on amazon because it never came in so I just purchased at my local Best Buy but this keyboard is Amazing and it is probably my last keyboard I’m going to purchase for a very long time unless Logitech comes out with somthing better soon 😏. I paired it with my Logitech G PRO Wireless Mouse .
customer_reviews.author: Nick DeLaRosa

customer_reviews.title: Very good second gaming keyboard to round out my logitech setup.
customer_reviews.text: So for the last two weeks I've been replacing all of my peripherals because my old keyboard and mouse were showing signs that the hardware was at it's lifes' end. I have to say, It's more quiet than I thought it'd be and feels really smooth to type on. The gaming software that they have set up for this isn't bad at all and comes with some really good lighting presets, my favorite being beepboop. All in all, it looks good aesthetically, feels good functionally, and does it's job spectacularly. I couldn't have asked for a better quality ten-keyless keyboard for my money.
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuel

customer_reviews.title: perfect keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard because my favorite overwatch pro player is using this. I was a little worried if this feels good, not sure.But after I received that I just wanted to use it everyday when playing the games, it even feels awesome when typing hearing the sounds of the keys(maybe not everyone likes the little bit loud sound of the keys) and you can even download an app to customize the LED light of the keys, there are tens of effects, you can also customize the colors, the brightness, the background color or the press key color, its just GOOD (my English is not that good, hope you understand me)
customer_reviews.author: Annaaaaaaaa

customer_reviews.title: Incredible for Gaming, Terrible for Typing.
customer_reviews.text: I've noticed a great increase in gaming ability on this keyboard. The quality is incredible, the switches feel so nice. Yet I stumble while typing more than ever. The softness of the key press is extremely satisfying, without any tactile bump. Zero clicky feeling whatsoever. It has the feel of a membrane key but the bottoming out of a mechanical keyboard, the opposite of most "mechanical membrane" key switches, that are just clicky membrane keyboards.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard! Swapped out my Razer Chroma for the ...
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard! Swapped out my Razer Chroma for the Logitech G Pro so that I can have a smaller keyboard on my desk for more speed mouse pad real estate. I love the fact the keys are incredibly quiet, as opposed to the loud clicky keys of my old Razer. Response is wonderful and I've had a bit of a performance increase (in my eyes) in some of my FPS games such as Overwatch.
customer_reviews.author: Dynamite

customer_reviews.title: Bad carnival-like colors on the keyboard. For single color, one must configure it with every reboot.
customer_reviews.text: Ii works fine but I would not stand the default colors rolling like a cloud on the keyboard. Too carnival-like for my taste. Yes, one can "configure it" for single color, but one has to do this again every single time one boots the computer. Bad engineering choice.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent traveller

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard came broken but i still love it.
customer_reviews.text: This isnt my first mechanical keyboard but this is the first key board ive ever used using the romer g switch and i have to say it feels good. The only issue I have is that there is no way of using cherry mx compatible key caps. One nice thing about the way these switches are made allows the leds to be very bright but when I got my keyboard on of the leds was off colored from the rest which became very annoying very quickly. Other than that I like the small form factor of the keyboard and the and the software is easy to use when it comes to setting up custom lights.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbi Huiting

customer_reviews.title: love the lights especially
customer_reviews.text: I needed a backlit keyboard that didn't crash Windows 10 and did not have the keypad on the right. This one fit the bill. But the major bonus that I'm eternally jazzed about is that the backlights are so cool!! It's been almost two weeks and I am no less enamored with them. I feel like a mystical wizard or something. lol.
customer_reviews.author: wingnut

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard I've had!
customer_reviews.text: Transitioned to this from Red dragon keyboard and haven't looked back. Romer G switches are amazing and are not loud. The G hub app is pretty reliable and is great for the keyboard as far as customizing the color coordination. Feels heavy and is built wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: wesley

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: A lot of people have different preferences on switch types and RGB but for me, this keyboard was just what I was looking for. The switch type is just what I was looking for: Tactile but not clicky or loud. It has just enough tactile feedback to satisfy me without my mic constantly picking up the click. And I was never a huge RGB guy but its worth mentioning that it looks really cool and you can customize it a lot. And I am in love with the tenkeyless design. So I would say worth a try.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good, but should be better
customer_reviews.text: I use it for gaming mostly, but some of the keys are now showing the wrong led backlit color..on at least 4 keys now ...no matter what color I change them to it's noticeable, change them to light blue for example and the ones that are broke are showing a blueish green(see attached screenshot and look at the N key as it's the most noticeable). My Razer Blackwidow Ultimate lasted 5 YEARS without a single failure ...this Logitech one should also..if only had it since Feb 23, 19. My concern is the quality of it, seems solid when you get it and start using it, but already failing ..the space bar keeps getting stuck also..
customer_reviews.author: Brian Spillane

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: This is my first ever mechanical keyboard and with all honesty, I love it and it is very nice. The build quality could be better, it has a minor little flex but it is fine, I won't be smashing it! But the keyboard can be as clicky as you want it to be, you can be smooth with it and the sound reduces by at least 40%. I love the logitech RGB when you enter into a specific game, the colors of the keyboard change especially if you are playing iRacing!!
customer_reviews.author: Ali A.

customer_reviews.title: Great keys but the LED tend to burn out.
customer_reviews.text: I bought my keyboard for 3 months, just recently 2 keys LED ("8" and "v") stop working as should. I contact Amazon and Logitech support and non of them really tried to help me and I couldn't use my warranty. If RGB is important to you so don't buy this keyboard. Any other gaming aspect this keyboard is great.
customer_reviews.author: Omer Zeira

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Ergonomic, Customizable
customer_reviews.text: First mechanical keyboard and i love it. Started taking it to work with me everyday so I'm already used to it when i get home. I mostly play Overwatch and it does the trick. I like having the extra number pad chopped off to make room for an extra large mouse-pad and low sensitivity (i do miss the number pad at work thou...). Only reason to pass is if you know you really like a particular cherry key but i personally it has just the right "clickyness"
customer_reviews.author: Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Best gaming keyboard IMO. Love the 10 keyless design, RomerG is great, excellent build quality.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this keyboard. It actually feels better and more accurate for my hands than my Corsair K95. Plus the tenkeyless design feels far more ergonomic since my hands arent off to the left side with my mouse in its normal spot. The build quality, RGB, RomerG are all excellent. Cant recommend this enough.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Casanova

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard, not super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Well built sturdy keyboard with really nice custom switches that feel good to press, are hard to missclick, and trigger at the top of the press. This however is not a very comfortable keyboard and at this price, especially from Logitech I expect more.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff the aeroETop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Pure Gaming Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Though I’m not a fan of these particular switches. They are perfect from a purely gaming standpoint. It’s responsive and has a ton of features for such a small keyboard the color syncs up nicely with my G Pro mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Trog

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming, Decent for typing. Overall a great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I personally, play a lot of games competitively such as fortnite, csgo, rainbow etc, and this small compact keyboard has a great feel while playing games with it. Responsive and easy to get used to. For typing, I find it hard as I have not yet gotten use to it. Overall I would recommend this keyboard as it closely represents a ducky keyboard which are very popular.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Rudy

customer_reviews.title: Good size and quality
customer_reviews.text: Good size and quality. The keys took a little getting use to. Sometimes I'm not sure if I pressed a key in far enough when I'm typing and find myself going back only to see I am double typing some letters....again just took some getting use to. Love being able to set up individual key colors for different games.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Brock-Lelyo

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard but lights out after less than 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard from a comfort and function standpoint, but not even 2 years into the lifespan I already have 6 keys that no longer light. Hardly seems worth the money if that is the quality of the device.
customer_reviews.author: Naanook

customer_reviews.title: fantastic keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I don't game but I own several of these keyboards because they look great (not cheesy like so much gaming focused hardware) and they are a pleasure to type on. I also like the customizable LED layouts.
customer_reviews.author: ??_RO7??

customer_reviews.title: Excellent keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. It’s a great keyboard that doesn’t take up a lot of space on my desk. I switched from a flat membrane keyboard to this so it took a while to get use to the keys. After a couple weeks I want fat fingering keys I didn’t intent to hit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Love the Romer-G keys
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Love the Romer-G keys. Have the tactile feeling I like but are much quieter than most gaming keyboards. Nice finish, cool RGB lighting, nice compact tenkeyless design. Only knocks against it are no USB ports, and the RGB lighting seems a little inconsistent in which profile it loads. Seems like a software issue. If they could add the extra USB passthrough port I'd give it 5 stars. Everything else is really top notch.
customer_reviews.author: Carty S.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: Probably my favorite keyboard so far. The software if easy to use and not intrusive. The size and shape is perfect. Great quality build and so nice to use. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Value
customer_reviews.text: I got this for an insane discount, it was about $65 and it's definitely worth it at that price. I love the switches and the overall texture of the keycaps. Very satisfied with this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Good build quality, low click delay
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it's tenkyless, and because logitech keyboards have lower click delay than almost every other keyboard. When I had a problem with a key not registering (was more my fault), they sent a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: andias

customer_reviews.title: works great for our living room computer hooked to our tv
customer_reviews.text: works great for our living room computer hooked to our tv, we wanted something small that didn't take up too much space and could fit in a lap or on a tray, and this works great for that. Plus the mechanical keys are great and a significant improvement over normal keys. And they aren't obnoxiously loud like the razer keyboards are.
customer_reviews.author: FTK

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality blue LED's.
customer_reviews.text: In 8 months 5 blue LED's failed. All of the red and green LED's are fine. The overall quality of the keyboard is good and it has a solid feel. The software is OK. But to have 5 blue LED's go out in this short span of time is ether poor quality LED's or perhaps over driving them. Whatever the reason, I cannot recommend this keyboard. I got this for the RGB (white, well sort of) back light. With the 5 blue LED's out, the white back light, is now not possible...
customer_reviews.author: James R. Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, Mac OS software suite needs work
customer_reviews.text: Pros: High quality materials and construction Mechanical keys very responsive Cons: Mac version of Logitech Gaming Software only runs while logged in so key and backlight profiles are only active when the application is running
customer_reviews.author: John D. Preston

customer_reviews.title: No replacement cable is available
customer_reviews.text: I have only one disappointment with it. The special cable broke and now I find you can't buy a replacement, none is available. You can use a standard cable without the reinforcements, but it's not as good. It's puzzling too, Logitech created an aftermarket purchase with the special cable, then they don't rake in the aftermarket bucks by making the cable available alone as a separate purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Solid material...feels sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I have been loving this keyboard for about a week now. It’s my first mechanical keyboard, so I can’t compare it to others of its kind. Having said that, it feels sturdy, nice keystrokes, and great lighting. The lighting is not too bright for gaming at night.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Good for me
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Had this for about a month and i really like it. The size really attracted me to buy this. You can change the lighting on the keyboard how you want it or just use the affects that are already on the program just like any other program.
customer_reviews.author: anna

customer_reviews.title: Not even a year old and keys already breaking...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is not even a year old, paint is chipping off, and the A key broke completely. I'm buying the coolermaster instead. The only way this is a pro keyboard is probably because they are replaced after every match. Garbage Logi, total garbage.
customer_reviews.author: qbn

customer_reviews.title: Really Great Keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: Not a gamer, just looking for a lighted keyboard that was 10-keyless. Works great, really like all the choices for the lighted keys. Like that it's just the keys that are back-lit, not the entire board. Really great features!
customer_reviews.author: J & R  Peterson

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING KEYBOARD!!
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING KEYBOARD!! Very noticeable difference in gaming, not clunky or slow! Feels very smooth and has fast response time and low actuation point! Highly suggest this keyboard especially Because it is cheaper than other RGB keyboards and is personally my favorite!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my use.
customer_reviews.text: Practically the same as my G810 without the ten-key but with the added bonuses of portability and a removable/replaceable USB cord. It could only be made more perfect by adding USB pass-through port(s) and updating to the new and improved USB C port.
customer_reviews.author: XC4LY3UR

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy keys and hard to fix.
customer_reviews.text: It was a cool keyboard for awhile until the W key broke off after only 2 months of use. The switches for the keys are Romer-G brand and thus you can only get replacements from Logitech for around $30. Completely unreliable and obvious cash scam by Logitech by making their own switches to sell more keycaps. Pretty angry with this purchase so I won't be buying Logitech again.
customer_reviews.author: Skrye Blackfall

customer_reviews.title: beautiful keyboard with some QC issue
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this keyboard feels solid. The light is bright. You can only stabilize the RGB light when installing logitech software, otherwise it can only do wave mode. The typing is not typical mechanical tactile keyboard. It is more on the smooth quiet side. The problem I had is it randomly resister ";" key. tried all solutions did not work. have to return for replacement. So far the replacement has no such problem.
customer_reviews.author: DanSmith

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard for gaming and everyday use.
customer_reviews.text: I could not be happier with this keyboard. I did not buy it for the RGB colors, but they are wonderfully bright. The typing experience is a pleasure; the closest Cherry branded switch would be brown, but it has a little more of a tactile feel while still remaining silent.
customer_reviews.author: Killroy7777

customer_reviews.title: The keyboard overall looks great and feels great for both typing and gaming
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard came in recently and has met all my expectations and even surpassed them. The romer g switches, in my opinion, are similar to cherry mx reds and browns but are much faster than the two. The keyboard overall looks great and feels great for both typing and gaming. However, there is this spring type noise that comes from the spacebar and backspace bar on my keyboard. This may just be mine, but this is the only con that I have found.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard feel for the office as well as gaming.
customer_reviews.text: I use this as my work keyboard. It's a little loud but not as loud as some mechanical keyboards so it doesn't irritate my coworkers. Great keyboard feel, nice back lighting on the keys. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Steven C. Santoni

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard if you're looking for small compact keyboard. Was using a corsair keyboard before this, using Cherry MX red silent switched before this and really enjoy these switches props to Logitech. Being able to quickly detach it is a bonus as well. :D
customer_reviews.author: Corton

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. It is compact and does not sound like a cheap mechanical keyboard with all the clicking I never once heard anyone call me a nerd and telling me to mute mic in game. My only complaint is my left ctrl button randomly pops out but I just snap it back on and it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Pinedo

customer_reviews.title: The best keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. I just changed from a Corsair K65 with speed switches. I am glad that I did. I have had Razer and Corsair off and on, but this is the best yet to me
customer_reviews.author: David A Pfeiffer

customer_reviews.title: I love this compact KB
customer_reviews.text: It doesnt differ much from my compact Razer KB, but it's still nice. I wish the usb was type c.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

product_meta.title: Logitech G Pro Mechanical Gaming Keyboard, 16.8 Million Colors RGB Backlit Keys, Ultra Portable Design, Detachable Micro USB Cable
product_meta.description: Logitech G Pro Gaming Mechanical Keyboard is designed and built to the exacting specifications of eSports athletes worldwide. Featuring the fastest and most durable Romer G switches in a compact and ultra portable ten keyless design, plus advanced performance built in: customizable Logitech RGB color lighting and lighting patterns, game mode button to disable Windows key and avoid accidental actuation, macros to execute complex commands in a single keystroke, 87 key anti ghosting and 26 key rollover for precision control, and onboard memory to store your lighting configuration. This is the wired Logitech keyboard designed to give you the competitive edge.
feature_bullets: Pro grade Logitech G mechanical keyboard built to the exacting specifications of ESports athletes for a competition level blend of speed, precision and quiet performance
Durable Romer G switches deliver 25 percent faster actuation than standard mechanical switches so every keypress is nearly instantaneous from fingers to screen ; Durability: 70 million keypresses
Ultra-portable sleek and compact design frees up table space for mouse movement and is easy to pack and transport to tournaments: Rock Solid Reliability
Detachable Micro USB cables features a three pronged design for an easy, secure connection and safe transport in your travel bag
Comes with three step angle adjustment and rubber feet for adequate stability during intense gaming. Requirements are windows 7 or later, mac OS x 10.10 or later

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars876 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
